00035 #include "../common/common.h"
00036 #include "../common/kernel.h"
00037 #include "../common/poptmx.h"
00038 #include "FreeImage.h"
00039 
00040 using namespace std;
00041 
00042 
00044 struct clargs {
00045   Path command;               
00046   Contrast contrast;            
00047   Filter filter_type;           
00048   float center;                   
00049   Path sinogram_name;         
00050   Path result_name;           
00051   float dd;             
00052   unsigned nof_threads;         
00053   bool beverbose;                               
00054   bool SaveInt;                                 
00055 
00057   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]); 
00058 };
00059 
00060 
00061 clargs::
00062 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00063   center(0),
00064   beverbose(false),
00065   nof_threads(0),
00066   SaveInt(false),
00067   result_name("reconstructed-<sinogram>"),
00068   dd(1.0)
00069 {
00070 
00071   poptmx::OptionTable table
00072         ("CT reconstruction of one sinogram.",
00073          "The program reads pre-formed sinogram and reconstructs it.");
00074 
00075   table
00076         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00077         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &sinogram_name, "sinogram",
00078       "Input image containing the sinogram.", "")
00079         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &result_name, "result",
00080                  "Output reconstructed image.", "", result_name)
00081 
00082         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00083         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &contrast, 'C', "contrast",
00084                  "Input component.",
00085                  "Type of the contrast presented in the sinogram. " + Contrast::Desc)
00086         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &center, 'c', "center",
00087                  "Rotation center.", CenterOptionDesc, toString(center))
00088         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &filter_type, 'f', "filter",
00089                  "Filtering window used in the CT.", FilterOptionDesc, filter_type.name())
00090         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &dd, 'r', "resolution",
00091                  "Pixel size (micron).", ResolutionOptionDesc, toString(dd))
00092     //  .add(poptmx::OPTION, &lambda, 'w', "wavelength",
00093     //  "Wave length (Angstrom).", "Wavelength.")
00094         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &nof_threads, 't', "threads",
00095                  "Number of threads used in calculations.",
00096                  "If the option is not used the optimal number is"
00097                  " calculated automatically.", "<auto>")
00098         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00099          "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00100         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00101         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00102 
00103   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00104         exit(0);
00105   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00106         table.usage();
00107         exit(0);
00108   }
00109 
00110   command = table.name();
00111 
00112   if ( ! table.count(&sinogram_name) )
00113         exit_on_error(command, string () +
00114                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&sinogram_name)+".");
00115   if ( ! table.count(&result_name) )
00116     result_name = upgrade(sinogram_name, "reconstructed-");
00117   if ( table.count(&dd) ) {
00118     if ( dd <= 0.0 )
00119       exit_on_error(command, "Negative pixel size (given by "+table.desc(&dd)+").");
00120     dd /= 1.0E6;
00121   }
00122 
00123 
00124 }
00125 
00126 
00127 
00129 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00130 
00131   const clargs args(argc, argv) ;
00132   
00133   Map sinogram;
00134   ReadImage( args.sinogram_name, sinogram );
00135   int pixels = sinogram.columns();
00136   Map result( pixels, pixels );
00137   const CTrec rec(pixels, args.contrast, args.nof_threads, args.filter_type);
00138   
00139   rec.reconstruct(sinogram, result, args.center);
00140   CTrec::finilize(result, sinogram.shape()(0), args.dd);
00141 
00142   //if ( args.contrast == Contrast::ABS && args.lambda != 0.0 )
00143   //    result *= args.lambda / (4*M_PI);
00146 
00147   SaveImage(args.result_name, result, args.SaveInt);
00148   
00149   exit(0);
00150 
00151 }
